Package trueshuffle

Class TrueShuffleClient

java.lang.Object
trueshuffle.TrueShuffleClient
public class TrueShuffleClient extends Object
Thread-safe class for managing TrueShuffle users.

  • Constructor Details

    • TrueShuffleClient

      public TrueShuffleClient(String cid, String secret, String redirectUri, boolean initialiseImmediately) throws TrueShuffleInitialisationException
      Creates a new client from provided client-id, secret and redirect uri (callback).
      Parameters:
      cid - The client-id to use.
      secret - The secret to use.
      redirectUri - The redirect uri (callback) to use for authorisation.
      initialiseImmediately - Whether to initialise this client immediately during construction of the class. If true, an attempt is made to verify the client-id, secret and redirect uri with Spotify by means of a web request. Otherwise, this instance cannot be used until a call is made to initialise() (note: you can call any function you want but they will all result in exceptions until initialisation). The constructor may throw exceptions when the initialisation fails.
      Throws:
      TrueShuffleInitialisationException - When an attempt to initialise this client fails.

  • Method Details

    • initialise

      public void initialise() throws TrueShuffleInitialisationException
      Attempts to initialise the client by verifying the client id and secret with Spotify.
      Throws:
      TrueShuffleInitialisationException

    • addAuthorisedUser

      public TrueShuffleUser addAuthorisedUser(String code) throws TrueShuffleAuthorisationException
      Attempts to add an authorised user to this client by validating the provided code with Spotify.
      Parameters:
      code - The code received from Spotify through the redirect (callback) link upon authorisation.
      Returns:
      The ShuffleApi that is bound to this specific user.
      Throws:
      TrueShuffleAuthorisationException - When the code provided is invalid (or could not be validated).

    • removeAuthorisedUser

      public void removeAuthorisedUser(String userId)
      Removes an authorised user from the set of authorised users.

    • getAuthorisedUsers

      public Set<String> getAuthorisedUsers()

    • shuffleLikedSongs

      public ShuffleJobStatus shuffleLikedSongs(String userId, Executor executor) throws UserNotFoundException
      Perform a shuffle on the provided playlist for a specific user, following the provided executor's schedule. If one wishes to monitor the status of this job, an asynchronous executor must be provided. Otherwise, this function, will not return until it has completed execution.
      Parameters:
      userId - The id of the user.
      executor - The execution schedule (should be an asynchronous schedule).
      Returns:
      The status of the shuffle job, which is updated continuously until it has finished.
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - When no user could be found with the provided user identifier.

    • shufflePlaylist

      public ShuffleJobStatus shufflePlaylist(String userId, String playlistId, Executor executor) throws UserNotFoundException
      Perform a shuffle on the provided playlist for a specific user, following the provided executor's schedule. If one wishes to monitor the status of this job, an asynchronous executor must be provided. Otherwise, this function, will not return until it has completed execution.
      Parameters:
      userId - The id of the user.
      playlistId - The id of the playlist to shuffle.
      executor - The execution schedule (should be an asynchronous schedule).
      Returns:
      The status of the shuffle job, which is updated continuously until it has finished.
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - When no user could be found with the provided user identifier.

    • getAuthorisedUser

      public TrueShuffleUser getAuthorisedUser(String userId) throws UserNotFoundException
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException

    • getAuthorisationURI

      public URI getAuthorisationURI(String state)
      Builds the URI for this client which redirects users to the authorisation page of spotify with the appropriate scopes and state.
      Parameters:
      state - Optional, but strongly recommended (ignored if blank). The state can be useful for correlating requests and responses. Because your redirect_uri can be guessed, using a state value can increase your assurance that an incoming connection is the result of an authentication request. If you generate a random string or encode the hash of some client state (e.g., a cookie) in this state variable, you can validate the response to additionally ensure that the request and response originated in the same browser. This provides protection against attacks such as cross-site request forgery.

    • generateRandomState

      public static String generateRandomState()
      Generates a random 'state' to be used for security purposes. Note that this generated state should be stored by the user in their own code as to be able to use it further down the authorisation flow. This program itself does nothing with it unless provided to some of this instance's functions, like getAuthorisationURI(String). The random state generated is produced by a call to UUID.randomUUID().
